isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC) SYSTEM - ProStar - REMOVE AND INSTALL - CONDENSER CORE

svcprocinfo.para: Depending on the vehicle model/engine combination, replacement of certain components may require the removal of nearby assemblies to gain access to fittings, components, or mounting hardware. Refer to the appropriate section(s) in the Master Service Manual for additional procedures.

note.para: Refer to Figure 24 while performing the following Remove and Install procedures.

step1.para: Discharge A/C system. Refer to DISCHARGING THE SYSTEM .
If necessary, unclip or unbolt condenser line support clamps and disconnect pressure transducer wiring connector to allow A/C lines to be moved out of the way.
Disconnect A/C line fittings from condenser and position the A/C lines out of the way.
Remove two bolts securing top mounting hangers to radiator frame.
Lift mounting hangers from top of condenser. Insure that rubber isolators remain in hanger sockets.
Lift condenser from sockets in bottom rail. Insure that rubber isolators remain in rail.
Verify that rubber isolators are installed in bottom condenser support rail.
Insert posts on bottom of condenser into sockets until condenser is fully seated.
Insure that rubber isolators are installed in top hanger sockets.
Install top mounting hangers onto posts on top of condenser. Verify that posts are fully seated into sockets.
Secure top mounting hangers to radiator frame using two bolts removed earlier.

If the system is to be flushed or purged, perform that operation before completing reassembly. Refer to PURGING OR FLUSHING THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM
.

note.para: Always lubricate A/C fitting O-rings with mineral-based oil during installation.

step1.para: Using new O-rings and C-plates connect A/C line fittings to condenser. Tighten to 19,000 to 21,000 N.mm (170 to 190 lbf-in).
If removed earlier, install any condenser line support clamps in their original location and orientation. Connect wiring to pressure transducer.
Install any assemblies that were removed to gain access to the condenser.

Recharge A/C system. Refer to CHARGING THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM
.
